entry.title: National Science Foundation Awards $5M Grant for Context Engineering Research
entry.summary: The Gnosis Research Center at Illinois Institute of Technology is thrilled to announce that Project IOWarp has received a significant $5 million grant from the National Science Foundation (Award #2411318). This landmark funding represents a major milestone in our mission to advance context engineering for autonomous scientific exploration.
entry.content:
The Gnosis Research Center at Illinois Institute of Technology is thrilled to announce that Project IOWarp has received a significant $5 million grant from the National Science Foundation (Award #2411318). This landmark funding represents a major milestone in our mission to advance context engineering for autonomous scientific exploration.

What This Means​

This grant enables IOWarp to accelerate research and development across the next five years (2024–2029), focusing on:

  • Context Engineering Infrastructure: Building the data nervous system for autonomous science
  • Multi-Agent Orchestration: Enabling AI agents to coordinate complex scientific workflows
  • HPC-AI Convergence: Seamless integration with high-performance computing environments
  • Scientific Workflow Automation: Reducing barriers to autonomous research

Grant Details​

ItemValue
Funding Amount$5,000,000 USD
Award NumberNSF #2411318
Project Duration2024–2029 (5 years)
Lead InstitutionIllinois Institute of Technology (Gnosis Research Center)
Partner InstitutionsUniversity of Utah, The HDF Group

The Vision​

IOWarp transforms scientific computing from passive file hierarchies to intelligent context infrastructure. AI agents can now autonomously navigate, understand, and act on scientific data.

What's Next​

This funding accelerates development of:

  • ClaudIO agent framework for scientific computing
  • 15+ MCP servers with 150+ specialized tools
  • Context Assimilation and Transfer Engines
  • Real-world deployment across national laboratories

Learn more at iowarp.ai

entry.title: IOWarp Platform Beta Release
entry.summary: IOWarp is excited to announce the official Beta Release of the IOWarp platform, effective November 14, 2025. This milestone marks the availability of a complete, production-grade runtime for autonomous scientific exploration backed by $5M NSF funding.
entry.content:
IOWarp is excited to announce the official Beta Release of the IOWarp platform, effective November 14, 2025. This milestone marks the availability of a complete, production-grade runtime for autonomous scientific exploration backed by $5M NSF funding.

What's Included​

The Beta Release features:

  • Content Assimilation Engine (CAE): Intelligently ingest and organize scientific data from diverse sources
  • Content Transfer Engine (CTE): Efficient data movement and orchestration across distributed systems
  • Agent Toolkit: 15+ MCP servers with 150+ specialized tools for scientific computing
  • Zero-Configuration Deployment: Docker-based setup requiring minimal configuration

Performance​

Real-world testing demonstrates 7.5x speedup in scientific workflows compared to traditional approaches. The EarthScope seismology demo showcases autonomous analysis of 150+ seismic stations in minutes.

Get Started​

  • Documentation: iowarp.ai/docs
  • GitHub: github.com/iowarp
  • Community: iowarp.zulipchat.com

entry.title: IOWarp Agent Toolkit Released - 15 MCP Servers for Scientific Computing
entry.summary: We're excited to announce the release of the IOWarp Agent Toolkit - a comprehensive collection of 15 MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers providing 150+ specialized tools for scientific computing workflows.
entry.content:
We're excited to announce the release of the IOWarp Agent Toolkit - a comprehensive collection of 15 MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers providing 150+ specialized tools for scientific computing workflows.

What's New​

The Agent Toolkit enables AI agents to:

  • Execute HPC workflows and job scheduling
  • Query and analyze scientific databases
  • Manipulate scientific data formats (HDF5, NetCDF, ADIOS)
  • Orchestrate complex multi-step pipelines
  • Integrate with visualization tools (ParaView, VisIt)

MCP Servers Included​

  • HPC Integration: SLURM, PBS, LSF job management
  • Data Formats: HDF5, NetCDF, ADIOS, Zarr readers/writers
  • Visualization: ParaView, VisIt automation
  • Analysis: NumPy, SciPy, pandas operations
  • Workflows: Jarvis CI/CD, workflow orchestration

Get Started​

Install the toolkit:

pip install iowarp-toolkit

Documentation: iowarp.ai/docs/agent-toolkit

entry.title: Luke Logan Joins IOWarp as Head Engineer
entry.summary: We're thrilled to announce that Luke Logan has joined the IOWarp team as Head Engineer, leading development of the IOWarp Core platform and Agent Toolkit.
entry.content:
We're thrilled to announce that Luke Logan has joined the IOWarp team as Head Engineer, leading development of the IOWarp Core platform and Agent Toolkit.

About Luke​

Luke brings extensive experience in high-performance storage systems and I/O optimization. His previous work includes:

  • Lead developer of LabStor, Hermes, and ChronoLog storage systems
  • Contributor to major HPC I/O optimization research
  • Expert in RDMA, NVMe, and GPU-direct storage

What Luke is Building​

As Head Engineer, Luke is leading:

  • IOWarp Core: The foundational runtime for context engineering
  • Agent Toolkit: MCP server ecosystem for scientific computing
  • Performance Optimization: Ensuring production-grade HPC performance
  • Integration: Seamless deployment across national lab environments

Welcome to the team, Luke!

entry.title: Illinois Tech Features IOWarp Research in Campus Spotlight
entry.summary: Illinois Institute of Technology's news office published a feature article highlighting the IOWarp project and its mission to transform scientific computing through autonomous AI agents.
entry.content:
Illinois Institute of Technology's news office published a feature article highlighting the IOWarp project and its mission to transform scientific computing through autonomous AI agents.

The Article​

The IIT feature explores:

  • How IOWarp enables autonomous scientific discovery
  • The $5M NSF grant supporting the research
  • Real-world applications across national laboratories
  • The vision for agentic science by 2030

Key Quote​

"IOWarp is building the data nervous system that will enable AI agents to conduct scientific research autonomously - from hypothesis generation to experiment design to publication." - Anthony Kougkas, Principal Investigator

Read the full article on the IIT News website.

About Gnosis Research Center​

The Gnosis Research Center at IIT focuses on intelligent I/O systems, storage optimization, and context engineering for scientific computing. IOWarp represents a decade of foundational research culminating in production infrastructure for autonomous science.
